Summary: 2 independently moving spheres, illuminated by sunlight at high altitude
divs: sighting detailsfirst, my 26 and 17 year old sons and myself are very familiar with aircraft; since we live under a flight path, near military installations, and are current with modern jet aircraft information.my sons have excellent eyesight, and i have corrected vision.we were at our home in the front of the house when the sighting occured. the event started when my youngest son visually detected two round objects near the 2\3 moon. the moon was at approx. 40 degrees above the horizon to the south\south-east.the sun was going down, and the sky was blue and clear-w\no clouds and excellent visibility.the two round objects were pointed out by my youngest son to my oldest son and myself, and we immediately saw the objects. we had no camera available with adequate lens magnification and the video camera's batt.s were dead.we did have a 25x spotting scope and a tripod which we set up immediately and used throughout the event.both objects were percieved to be at high altitude, and were not star like; although they were luminescent(perhaps sunlight reflection).the objects moved from the right to the left of the moon and gained altitude as they did so, as measured by their proximity to the moon. the two objects never crossed in front of the moon. they did move independent of each other and reversed their direction several times during the observation.both objects maintained the same size and brightness during the 20 minute observation until they moved away and then diminished in brightness. they would gradually move and then stop, sometimes one would stop or slow down and the other would close in next to it's companion. right before the objects moved beyond sight with the scope, the one that maintained it's position on the right very quickly\instantly moved (no percieved gradual acceleration)to the right away from it's companion and went out of magnified sight. the remaining object continued to move away and upward until it to was gone. at no time did the objects appear to be conventional aircraft, and no additional lights, or other colors beside the white luminouscity were seen on the objects.
